roleset.name: to move clumsily

example.name: with PP
example.text: Just when American liberalism had pulled the arms plug on the Contras and their friend Ronald Reagan [*T*-3] , along comes [*T*-2] [Mr. Ortega]-5 in Costa Rica this weekend [*-5] to `` blunder '' into the hands of what [*T*-1] are often called [*-4] conservatives .

propbank.arg: into the hands of what [*T*-1] are often called [*-4] conservatives

roleset.note: BLUNDER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'blunder' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from blunder.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: to make a mistake

example.name: both arguments
example.text: Some financial sources said privately that Paribas blundered in [*] failing [*-1] to move sooner for the insurance and industrial group , [*] bidding only after speculation had pushed up the price .

propbank.arg: in [*] failing [*-1] to move sooner for the insurance and industrial group

roleset.note: BLUNDER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'blunder' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from blunder.02-v predicate notes)
